document.masterDocTitle: A review of the genus Miridiba Reitter (Coleoptera: Scarabaeidae: Melolonthinae) of Taiwan

1 male
, CCLI ).

Female . Body length 16.5–22.3mm ; width across humeri 7.6–10.1 mm . Antennal club shorter than in male, subequal to length of antennomeres 3–6 combined. Setae on elytral disc short, subequal to diameter of puncture, except for setae at base.

Diagnosis. See diagnosis of
M. huesiotoi
for comparison of species.
Chinese name. 蓬萊脊頭鰓金龜

Remarks.
Miridiba formosana
is common in Taiwan and sympatric with
M . sinensis
but is absent from the southernmost part of Taiwan . The temporal distribution of
M. formosana
is from the end of April to August.
